tp:treatment-sec.p:
Electrocambala ornata
gen. et sp. nov.

Electrocambala
gen. nov. differs from
Kachincambala
gen. nov. by the presence of an accessory spine on the tarsus ( Figs 1E , 3G ). The anterior gonopod carries two rounded coxal lobes, the coxite is as long as the telopodite, and the outer lobe of the coxite is ⅓ as long as the inner lobe. The apex of the posterior gonopod is curved anteriorly, creating an open channel ( Fig. 1G–H ).

Electrocambala cretacea
gen. et sp. nov.
